page.title: 04A farmer's day in N.Duffield
page.content: {A Day On A Farm}The farmer we talked to gets up at half past six in the morning and goes out to milk the cows. The cows take one hour to be milked, there are forty cows altogether.At lunch break he has one hour.After lunch he mostly works out in the fields.The people that help him on the farm are self employed.Women are only employed seasonally.He owns and looks after two hundred and twenty acres.The land is used for grazing and crops.To help him he has tractors,combine harvesters and root crop harvesters.On the farm he owns heffers, beef cattle and calves.Every day on the farm is extremely busy.The milking is very hard and so is caring for the life stock.On a night in winter he gets home at six 'o'clock and in summer it is half past eight.
